moves.1. e4 b6 2. d4 Bb7: Black counters Greco's center thrusts with a Q-side fianchetto.
moves.3. Bd3 f5: A double attack on the White KP.
moves.4. exf5: Greco takes the simplest way out, simply capturing the attacking Pawn.
moves.4... Bxg2: Black equalizes the material and threatens to capture the White KR.
moves.5. Qh5+: Greco never was one to be passive. With his KR attacked, he launches a counterstrike!
moves.6. fxg6: Threatening PxP dis ch or P-N7 dis ch, followed by Queening.
moves.6... Nf6: Black counters by threatening to take Greco's checking Q off the board in case of a discovery.
moves.7. gxh7+: Greco goes through with his plan.
moves.7... Nxh5: Black follows through with his counter. But...
moves.8. Bg6#: Greco goes to his backup plan and finishes the game beautifully!
